column1: Deán Funes is a city in the province of Córdoba
column4: and is the head town of the Ischilín Department. It is the largest city in the northwest of the province. It lies by National Route 60
column5: 118 km from the provincial capital Córdoba.

column1: The settlement was founded as Villa de Deán Funes on 9 March 1875
column2: when the Ferrocarril Central Norte from Córdoba reached the area. It received its name honouring Gregorio Funes
column3: a writer and deacon of the Archdiocese of Córdoba who was a deputy to the Junta Grande after the May Revolution of 1810. It received a strong wave of immigration
column7: and Yugoslavians. The town was officially declared a city on 29 October 1929.

column1: The city hosts the Northern Córdoba Tradition Festival annually on the first half of January.
